articles.headline: Drone Shopping? F.A.A. Rules May Hover Over Holidays
articles.snippet: Recommendations by a Federal Aviation Administration task force call for owners to register and for the aircraft to display identification numbers.
articles.abstract: Recommendations by a Federal Aviation Administration task force call for owners to register and for the aircraft to display identification numbers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Drones, those remote-controlled flying machines, are expected to top many wish lists this holiday season.

articles.headline: Barry Diller’s Business Model Bears Fruit
articles.snippet: IAC/InterActiveCorp, the hodgepodge of Internet businesses, has come under scrutiny. But today, the numbers tell a different story.
articles.abstract: IAC/InterActiveCorp, the hodgepodge of Internet businesses, has come under scrutiny. But today, the numbers tell a different story.
articles.lead_paragraph: Pop quiz. Which company has created more value for shareholders over the last two decades: Disney, Microsoft or IAC/InterActiveCorp?

articles.headline: Putting the Chicken Before the Egg
articles.snippet: The market, while still small, is growing fast for pastured eggs, which means that hens live in housing that allows them to spend much of their day in open pasture.
articles.abstract: The market, while still small, is growing fast for pastured eggs, which means that hens live in housing that allows them to spend much of their day in open pasture.
articles.lead_paragraph: CRESCENT CITY, Calif. — A decade ago, a couple running a dairy business in Northern California visited a Mennonite farm where the owner had used a flock of laying hens to teach his children business principles and instill values like responsibility and care for nature.

articles.headline: Paris Attacks Spur Emergency Edict and Intense Policing in France
articles.snippet: With expanded police powers extended for three more months, some, particularly Muslims, question whether the loss of liberties is appropriate.
articles.abstract: With expanded police powers extended for three more months, some, particularly Muslims, question whether the loss of liberties is appropriate.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — All over France, from Toulouse in the south to Paris and beyond, the police have been breaking down doors, conducting searches without warrants, aggressively questioning residents, hauling suspects to police stations and putting others under house arrest.

articles.headline: Elliott Management Appoints Jonathan Pollock as Co-Chief Executive
articles.snippet: For the first time, the founder of Elliott Management will run the $27 billion investment firm with a partner.
articles.abstract: For the first time, the founder of Elliott Management will run the $27 billion investment firm with a partner.
articles.lead_paragraph: For most of its 38 years, Elliott Management has been a lucrative hedge fund run solely by its founder, the billionaire Paul E. Singer, a man known for his hard-nosed trades and outsize influence in politics.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Alexandra Stevenson

articles.headline: Chris Christie’s Bid Gains New Life as He Invokes 9/11 Amid Fear
articles.snippet: The Paris attacks have brought a sudden intensity, attention and focus to the once-moribund candidacy of Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey.
articles.abstract: The Paris attacks have brought a sudden intensity, attention and focus to the once-moribund candidacy of Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey.
articles.lead_paragraph: STRATHAM, N.H. — In the course of a two-hour campaign stop here, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey brought a handful of men and women to tears describing the deathbed wishes of his cancer-ridden mother, cracked them up with the declaration that his presidency would be golf-free and riveted them with his remembrances of the family friends he lost on Sept. 11, 2001.

articles.headline: Pfizer-Allergan Merger Reignites Tax Reform Discussion
articles.snippet: The blockbuster pharmaceutical merger has put new pressure on Congress and the White House to overhaul the corporate tax code.
articles.abstract: The blockbuster pharmaceutical merger has put new pressure on Congress and the White House to overhaul the corporate tax code.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For almost four years, Congress and the White House have done little to make their long-promised overhaul of the corporate tax code a reality. Now the blockbuster pharmaceutical merger of Pfizer and Allergan has put new pressure on all sides to act.

articles.headline: NATO-Russia Tensions Rise After Turkey Downs Jet
articles.snippet: In a clash with Cold War overtones, Turkey shot down a Russian warplane that it said had strayed into its territory. Russia called the incident a “stab in the back.”
articles.abstract: In a clash with Cold War overtones, Turkey shot down a Russian warplane that it said had strayed into its territory. Russia called the incident a “stab in the back.”
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Two big powers supporting different factions in the Syrian civil war clashed with each other on Tuesday when Turkish fighter jets shot down a Russian warplane that Turkey said had strayed into its airspace.
articles.byline: By Neil MacFarquhar and Steven Erlanger
